content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's an implementation of the `q_and_a_extractor` function in Julia:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md)
    # Extract Question and Answer sections
    question_start = findfirst(startswith("# Question"), md), 1)
    answer_start = nothing
    if question_start !== nothing
        answer_start = findnext(occursin("# Answer", md)), question_start, length(md))
    end

    # Extract question and answer text, removing leading spaces and newlines
    if question_start !== nothing && answer_start !== nothing
        question_text = stripleadingwhitespace(md[question_start:end(answer_start)]]))
        answer_text = stripleadingwhitespace(md[answer_start:end(length(md)))]])
        return (question_text, answer_text)
    else
        return (nothing, nothing)  # No Question and Answer sections found
    end
end
```

You can use this function by passing your markdown-formatted text `md` as an argument. It will return a tuple containing the question and answer text, with leading spaces and newlines removed. If no Question and Answer sections are found, it will return `(nothing, nothing)`.
